Custom Fill Scale for USG eCampus Palettes

Source: R/scale_fill_usg.R
scale_fill_usg.Rd

This function applies a custom fill scale using predefined color palettes from ecampus_palettes. It supports both discrete and continuous data, automatically determining the appropriate scale.

Usage

scale_fill_usg(
  branch = "USG-eCore",
  type = "Official Colors",
  data,
  reverse = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

branch

The branch name. Default is "USG-eCore".

type

The type of palette. Default is "Official Colors".

data

The data to be used for mapping colors. Can be factor, character, or numeric.

reverse

Logical, should the color order be reversed? Default is FALSE.

...

Additional arguments passed to scale_fill_manual or scale_fill_gradientn.

Value

A ggplot2 scale object, either scale_fill_manual() (for discrete data) or scale_fill_gradientn() (for continuous data).

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Example for discrete data
df_discrete <- data.frame(
  category = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),
  value = c(10, 15, 7, 12)
)
ggplot(df_discrete, aes(x = category, y = value, fill = category)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
  scale_fill_usg(branch = "USG-eCore", type = "Official Colors", data = df_discrete$category) +
  theme_minimal()

# Example for continuous data
df_continuous <- data.frame(
  x = 1:10,
  y = 1:10,
  z = rnorm(10)
)
ggplot(df_continuous, aes(x = x, y = y, fill = z)) +
  geom_tile() +
  scale_fill_usg(branch = "USG-eCore", type = "Official Colors", data = df_continuous$z) +
  theme_minimal()
} # }
